sentence.Network_en: The facts of the situation belie his testimony.
sentence.Network_cn: 实际情况证明他作了伪证。

sentence.Network_en: Her energy and youthful good looks belie her 65 years.
sentence.Network_cn: 她的活力与年轻美貌使人看不出她有65岁了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  belēogan 'deceive by lying', from be- 'about' + lēogan 'lie'. Current senses date from the 17th cent

entry.def: If one thing belies another, it hides the true situation and so creates a false idea or image of someone or something.

entry.tran: 证明…是虚假的；显示…不真实
entry.def: If one thing belies another, it proves that the other thing is not true or genuine.

example.ex: The facts of the situation belie his testimony.
example.tran: 实际情况证明他作了伪证。

auth_sentence.content: It was rendered criminal to belie the subjects of the king.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was rendered criminal to belie the subjects of the king.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was rendered criminal to belie the subjects of the king.

auth_sentence.content: Every university has its own particular strengths, and they often belie the rankings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Every university has its own particular strengths, and they often belie the rankings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Every university has its own particular strengths, and they often belie the rankings.

auth_sentence.content: However, to linger on just a couple of tracks would belie how many facets this album possesses.
auth_sentence.res_content: However, to linger on just a couple of tracks would belie how many facets this album possesses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: However, to linger on just a couple of tracks would belie how many facets this album possesses.

means.word_mean: 掩饰；给人以…假象, 使被误解

sentences.en: Her smile belied her true feelings.
sentences.cn: 她的微笑掩饰了她的真实感情。

sentences.en: The gentle lower slopes belie the true nature of the mountain.
sentences.cn: 低缓的山坡掩盖了这座山的真实特点。
